task: Make cereal and coffee for breakfast
privileged_goal: Eggs should be prepared with a side of vegetables
Avocados are a favorite as a side, and especially necessary on toast
Beverages like coffee and tea are preferred is preferred black without any added sugars or creamers
To maintain a vegan diet, use vegan alternatives to milk
To maintain a vegan diet, use vegan alternatives to cheese when cooking eggs
To maintain a vegan diet, use vegan alternatives to yoghurts
A side of berries is a nice complement for any breakfast meal, no matter whether it is savory or sweet
A side of nuts is a nice complement for any sweet breakfast
Serve food directly at the standing desk to start the work day right away

rollout.progress_summary: You have not made anything yet.
rollout.privileged_info: Remember, Lisa's preferences include: Beverages like coffee and tea are preferred is preferred black without any added sugars or creamers, To maintain a vegan diet, use vegan alternatives to milk, A side of berries is a nice complement for any breakfast meal, no matter whether it is savory or sweet, A side of nuts is a nice complement for any sweet breakfast.
rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

rollout.action: Ask "What type of cereal would you like to have for breakfast?"
action_args: "what type of cereal would you like to have for breakfast?"
rollout.user_feedback: I'm glad you're excited to start the day with a delicious breakfast. Since I'm a vegan, I'd love it if you could choose a cereal that's vegan-friendly. I'm usually flexible with my cereal choices, but if I had to pick, I'd say go for the gluten-free granola or the light Swiss muesli. Both of those options are great, but if you want to mix things up, the fruit loops or corn flakes would be okay too.
rollout.planner_prompt:
<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Lisa wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g. 
Action: Move apple_0 from counter_0 to table_0.Do NOT repeat your last action.
Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

You have no prior information about Lisa.

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Lisa wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Lisa wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2

rollout.action: Ask "Would you like your coffee hot or iced, and would you prefer a light, medium, or strong brew?"
action_args: "would you like your coffee hot or iced, and would you prefer a light, medium, or strong brew?"
rollout.user_feedback: For my coffee, I'd love it if you could make it a strong brew, black, without any added sugars or creamers. I'm usually flexible with the temperature, but if I had to choose, I'd say hot coffee is my go-to.

<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Lisa wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g. 
Action: Move apple_0 from counter_0 to table_0.Do NOT repeat your last action.
Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

rollout.action: Ask "Would you like any additional toppings or fruits with your cereal, such as sliced banana, berries, or nuts?"
action_args: "would you like any additional toppings or fruits with your cereal, such as sliced banana, berries, or nuts?"
rollout.user_feedback: That sounds like a great question. Since I'm a big fan of berries, I'd love it if you could add some fresh or frozen berries to my cereal. Usually, I'm open to trying different fruits, but berries are a great complement to my breakfast. If you want to get creative, sliced banana or a handful of nuts like almonds or walnuts would be a nice addition too.

<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Lisa wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g. 
Action: Move apple_0 from counter_0 to table_0.Do NOT repeat your last action.
Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.

root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

n ::= [0-9]

rollout.user_feedback: I'd love it if you could have my coffee and cereal together on the table. Usually, I enjoy eating and drinking in a relaxed and casual setting, and having everything together on the table makes it feel more like a special treat. If you want to mix things up, having them in separate areas would be okay too, but together on the table is my preference.

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

rollout.action: Ask "Would you like to sit down at the table while I prepare your breakfast, or would you like to stay standing and chat with me while I work?"
action_args: "would you like to sit down at the table while i prepare your breakfast, or would you like to stay standing and chat with me while i work?"
rollout.user_feedback: I'd love it if you could bring my breakfast to the standing desk, so I can eat and work at the same time. Usually, I like to multitask and get a head start on my day, and eating at the standing desk feels like a great way to do that. If you want to mix things up, we could sit down at the table, but the standing desk is my usual spot.

rollout.action: Ask "Would you like to sit down at the table while I prepare your breakfast, or would you like to stay standing and chat with me while I work?"
action_args: "would you like to sit down at the table while i prepare your breakfast, or would you like to stay standing and chat with me while i work?"
rollout.user_feedback: We already discussed this, but to confirm, I'd love it if you could bring my breakfast to the standing desk, so I can eat and work at the same time. Usually, I like to multitask and get a head start on my day, and eating at the standing desk feels like a great way to do that. If you want to mix things up, we could sit down at the table, but the standing desk is my usual spot.

- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0

- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2

- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.

- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. rollout.user_feedback: That sounds like a great plan. Usually, I'm a fan of the pour-over method, and heating up the almond milk while the coffee is brewing is a great way to get everything ready at the same time. If you want to mix things up, we could use the drip coffee maker instead, but pour-over is my go-to.

action_args: "would you like me to start by boiling some water for the pour-over coffee maker, or would you like me to start by heating up the almond milk in the microwave?"
rollout.user_feedback: I'd love it if you could start by boiling some water for the pour-over coffee maker. Usually, I find that getting the water to the right temperature is an important step in making a great cup of coffee, and it's best to do it before heating up the almond milk. If you want to mix things up, we could heat up the almond milk first, but boiling the water is my usual preference.

rollout.action: Ask "Do you have a preferred type of cereal that you would like to have with your coffee?"
action_args: "do you have a preferred type of cereal that you would like to have with your coffee?"
rollout.user_feedback: I'd love it if you could choose the gluten-free seeds and nuts granola for my cereal. Usually, I'm a fan of granola as a cereal option, and the gluten-free version is a great choice for me. If you want to mix things up, the whole wheat shreds or the light Swiss muesli would be okay too, but granola is my usual preference.
rollout.planner_prompt:
<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Lisa wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

action_args: "would you like me to start making the coffee using the pour-over coffee maker, and i'll heat up the almond milk for your cereal while it's brewing?"
rollout.user_feedback: We already discussed this, but to confirm, I'd love it if you could start making the coffee using the pour-over coffee maker, and heat up the almond milk for my cereal while it's brewing. Usually, I'm a fan of the pour-over method, and heating up the almond milk while the coffee is brewing is a great way to get everything ready at the same time. If you want to mix things up, we could use the drip coffee maker instead, but pour-over is my go-to.

root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Lisa wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g. 
Action: Move apple_0 from counter_0 to table_0.Do NOT repeat your last action.
Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Lisa wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g.

Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

rollout.user_feedback: I'd love it if you could use a kettle to boil the water. root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Lisa wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g. 
Action: Move apple_0 from counter_0 to table_0.Do NOT repeat your last action.
Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Lisa wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2

root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

rollout.action: Ask "You mentioned earlier that you'd like to have your coffee and cereal together on the standing desk
action_args: "you mentioned earlier that you'd like to have your coffee and cereal together on the standing desk
rollout.user_feedback: I'd love it if you could bring my coffee and cereal to the standing desk, so I can eat and work at the same time. Usually, I like to multitask and get a head start on my day, and eating at the standing desk feels like a great way to do that. If you want to mix things up, we could sit down at the table, but the standing desk is my usual spot.

<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Lisa wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

rollout.action: Ask "Now that the kettle is plugged in, would you like me to turn it on to boil the water for the pour-over coffee maker?"
action_args: "now that the kettle is plugged in, would you like me to turn it on to boil the water for the pour-over coffee maker?"
rollout.user_feedback: I'd love it if you could turn on the kettle to boil the water for the pour-over coffee maker. Usually, I find that getting the water to the right temperature is an important step in making a great cup of coffee, and it's best to do it now. If you want to mix things up, we could use a pot on the stove, but the kettle is my go-to.

<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Lisa wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g. 
Action: Move apple_0 from counter_0 to table_0.Do NOT repeat your last action.
Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

rollout.user_feedback: I'd love it if you could prepare the gluten-free seeds and nuts granola for my cereal, and heat up the almond milk to the right temperature. Usually, I'm a fan of granola as a cereal option, and heating up the almond milk to the right temperature is an important step in making a great bowl of cereal. If you want to mix things up, we could use a different type of cereal or milk, but granola and almond milk are my usual preference.

root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

n ::= [0-9]

root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

rollout.user_feedback: I'd love it if you could start making the coffee using the pour-over coffee maker, and I'll prepare the gluten-free seeds and nuts granola for my cereal, and heat up the almond milk to the right temperature. Usually, I'm a fan of the pour-over method, and I find that it brings out the best flavors in the coffee. If you want to mix things up, we could use the drip coffee maker instead, but pour-over is my go-to.

action_args: "would you like to start by asking me to grind the coffee beans for the pour-over coffee maker, or would you like to ask me to start preparing the gluten-free seeds and nuts granola for your cereal?"
rollout.user_feedback: I'd love it if you could start by asking me to grind the coffee beans for the pour-over coffee maker. Usually, I find that freshly ground coffee beans make a big difference in the flavor of the coffee, and it's best to do it before making the coffee. If you want to mix things up, we could start by preparing the gluten-free seeds and nuts granola for my cereal, but grinding the coffee beans is my usual preference.

rollout.action: Ask "Would you like to start by asking me to hand you the coffee beans, or would you like to ask me to show you where the coffee grinder is located?"
action_args: "would you like to start by asking me to hand you the coffee beans, or would you like to ask me to show you where the coffee grinder is located?"
rollout.user_feedback: I'd love it if you could hand me the coffee beans. Usually, I like to have the coffee beans in front of me so I can grind them to the right consistency. If you want to mix things up, you could show me where the coffee grinder is located, but handing me the coffee beans is my usual preference.
rollout.planner_prompt:
<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Lisa wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g.
